params.name: groupRequestIds
params.doc:
IDs of the requests create groups to approve.

Max: 100 create group request IDs

docs.summary: Approves requests to create a group.
description:
The `approveGroupRequests()` function returns a Promise that resolves when a site member's request to create a group is approved. Only site admins can approve requests to create a group. When the request is approved, the new group is added to the Groups List page of your site.

>**Note:** This function is only relevant if admin approval is required for creating a group.

examples.title: Approve a request to create a group (dashboard page code)
body: *         "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",
*         "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",

examples.title: Approve a request to create a group (export from backend code)
body: *         "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",
*         "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",

docs.summary: Lists requests to create a group.
description:
The `listGroupRequests()` function returns a Promise that resolves to a list of up to 1,000 create group requests on your site.

Using the options parameter, you can filter your list of posts, set the amount of posts to be returned, and sort your list in a specified order.

By default, the list is sorted by `_createdDate` in descending order. Only admins can see create group requests. Members can access their own create group requests in their site.

>**Note:** This function is only relevant if admin approval is required for creating a group.

examples.title: Lists requests to create a group (dashboard page code)
body: *         "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",
*         "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",
*         "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",

body: *         "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",
*         "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",
*         "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",

docs.summary: Creates a query to retrieve a list of create requests.
description: The `queryGroupRequests()` function builds a query to retrieve a list of all requests to create a group, and returns a [`GroupRequestsQueryBuilder`](#grouprequestsquerybuilder) object.

The returned object contains the query definition which is typically used to run the query using the [`find()`](#grouprequestsquerybuilder/find) function. You can refine the query by chaining `GroupRequestQueryBuilder` functions onto the query. `GroupRequestQueryBuilder` functions enable you to sort, filter, and control the results that `queryGroupRequests()` returns.
`queryGorupRequests()` runs with these `GroupRequestsQueryBuilder` defaults, which you can override:

The following `GroupRequestsQueryBuilder` functions are supported for `queryGroupRequests()`. For a full description of the `GroupRequests` object, see the object returned for the [`items`](#grouprequestsqueryresult/items) property in [`GroupRequestsQueryResult`](#grouprequestsqueryresult).

examples.title: Query requests to create a group (dashboard page code)
body: *      "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",
*      "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",
*      "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",

examples.title: Query requests to create a group (export from backend code)
body: *      "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",
*      "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",
*      "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",

docs.summary: Rejects a request to create a group.
description:
The `rejectGroupRequests()` function returns a Promise that resolves when a member's request to create a group is rejected. Only site admins can reject requests to create a group.

>**Note:** This function is only relevant if admin approval is required for creating a group.

examples.title: Reject a request to create a group (dashboard page code)
body: //    reason: 'This group is for teachers only'
*         "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",

examples.title: Reject a request to create a group (export from backend code)
body: //    reason: 'This group is for teachers only'
*         "description": "Welcome to the group! You can connect with other members, get updates and share videos.",

members.name: type
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'ADMIN_APPROVAL'`
- `'EVENTS'`
- `'PAID_PLANS'`
- `'UNKNOWN'`

members.name: groupRequestIds
members.doc:
IDs of the requests create groups to approve.

Max: 100 create group request IDs

members.name: groupRequest
members.doc: Approved request to create a group.

members.name: groupRequestId
members.doc: ID of the Group Request to cancel.

members.name: groupRequest
members.doc: Canceled Group Request.

members.name: image
members.doc: Cover image.

members.name: mobilePosition
members.doc: Position of the corner of the cover image (or logo) for mobile browser.

members.name: position
members.doc: Position of the corner of the cover image (or logo).

members.name: _createdDate
members.doc: Date and time the group was created.

members.name: _id
members.doc: Group ID.

members.name: _updatedDate
members.doc: Date and time the group was last updated.

members.name: coverImage
members.doc: Group cover image. You cannot upload your own cover image.

members.name: description
members.doc: Group Description.

members.name: lastActivityDate
members.doc:
Date and time the group was last active.

For example, a post or comment made in the group.

members.name: memberTitle
members.doc:
What group members are called.

For example, 'Coworkers', 'Friends', or 'Students'.

members.name: membersCount
members.doc: Total number of members in the group.

members.name: name
members.doc: Group name.

members.name: ownerId
members.doc: Member ID of the group creator.

members.name: privacyStatus
members.doc:
Group privacy status.
- `"PUBLIC"` - Site visitors can see the group and its content in the list of groups. Members can join the group.
- `"PRIVATE"` - Site visitors can see the group in the list of groups, but only site members can see its content. Members can request to join the group.
- `"SECRET"` - Only admins and group members can see the group and its content in the list of groups. Members can only join a group if invited by group admins, or other group members.

members.name: settings
members.doc: Group settings.

members.name: slug
members.doc:
Part of a group's URL.

For example, `'https:/example.com/groups/{my-group-slug}'`. Generally based on the group name, but for secret groups it is an autogenerated string of characters, for example, `'https:/example.com/groups/{5D3yTX}'`. It is case-sensitive.

members.name: teaser
members.doc: Group teaser.

members.name: logo
members.doc: Group logo. You cannot upload your own logo.

members.name: membersTitle
members.doc: What group members are called, for example `Coworkers`, `Friends`, or `Students`.

members.name: x
members.doc: horizontal coordinate

members.name: y
members.doc: vertical coordinate

members.name: _id
members.doc: ID of the request to create a group. Same as group ID.

members.name: group
members.doc: Group requested to create.

members.name: requestDetails
members.doc: Details of request to create a group.

members.name: status
members.doc:
Status of the request to create a group. One of:
- `"PENDING"` - Pending group request.
- `"APPROVED"` - Approved group request.
- `"REJECTED"` - Rejected group request.
- `"CANCELED"` - Canceled group request.

description:
>**Notes:**
> + Site owners may set that members are not permitted to create groups in the Wix Groups application settings.
> + In this situation, site members have to submit a Group Request to create a new group.
> + Group Requests can be approved or rejected by an admin.
> + After a Group Request has been approved, the new group is added to the Group List in the Wix Groups app home page.
> + See [Introduction](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/wix-groups/groups/introduction#wix-groups_groups_introduction_terminology) for more details.

members.name: groupRequest
members.doc: Approved group request.

members.name: groupRequest
members.doc: Rejected group request.

members.name: groupDetailsChangedPostEnabled
members.doc:
Whether to create an automatic group post when group details are changed.

Default: `true`

members.name: membersCanApprove
members.doc:
Whether group members can approve or reject requests to join a group. When `false`, only site admins and group admins can approve or reject requests to join a group.

Default: `false`

members.name: membersCanInvite
members.doc:
Whether group members can send an email inviting others to join the group. When `false`, only site admins and group admins can invite others to join the group.

Default: `false`

members.name: showMemberList
members.doc:
Whether all group members can view the full list of group members.

Default: `true`

members.name: welcomeMemberPostEnabled
members.doc:
Whether to create a daily group post welcoming new members.

Default: `true`

members.name: _id
members.doc: Member ID of the group creator.  See [Members API](https://dev.wix.com/api/rest/members/members/about-wix-members) for more details.

members.name: identityType
members.doc:
Supported values:
- `'MEMBER'`
- `'USER'`

members.name: height
members.doc: Image height.

members.name: mediaId
members.doc: Image ID (for internal use).

members.name: width
members.doc: Image width.

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of items to load.

Max: `100`

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: limit
members.doc: Number of items to load. Maximum `100`.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: groupRequests

members.name: metadata

members.doc: Logo image ID (for internal use).

members.name: width
members.doc: Logo image width.

members.name: limit
members.doc:
Number of items to load.

Max: `100`

members.name: offset
members.doc: Number of items to skip in the current sort order.

members.name: count
members.doc: Number of items returned in the response.

members.name: offset
members.doc: Offset that was requested.

members.name: tooManyToCount
members.doc: Flag that indicates the server failed to calculate the `total` field.

members.name: total
members.doc: Total number of items that match the query.

members.name: x
members.doc: horizontal coordinate

members.name: y
members.doc: vertical coordinate

members.name: fields
members.doc: Array of projected fields. A list of specific field names to return. If `fieldsets` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: fieldsets
members.doc: Array of named, predefined sets of projected fields. A array of predefined named sets of fields to be returned. Specifying multiple `fieldsets` will return the union of fields from all sets. If `fields` are also specified, the union of `fieldsets` and `fields` is returned.

members.name: filter
paging
members.doc: Paging options to limit and skip the number of items.

members.name: sort
members.doc:
Sort object in the following format:
`[{"fieldName":"sortField1","order":"ASC"},{"fieldName":"sortField2","order":"DESC"}]`

members.doc: Rejection data.

members.name: reason
members.doc:
Reason the request to create a group is rejected. This text is displayed to the creator of the rejected request.

Max: 1,000 characters.

members.name: rejectionReason
members.doc: Reason the request to create a group is rejected.

members.name: fieldName
members.doc: Name of the field to sort by.

members.name: order
members.doc: Sort order.

members.doc: Group submitted for creation.

members.doc: Group submitted for creation.
